title: Ukrainian (1581) Ostrog Bible
description:
The Ostrog Bible (Ukrainian: Острозька Біблія, romanized: Ostroz’ka Bibliya; Russian: Острожская Библия, romanized: Ostrozhskaya Bibliya) was one of the earliest East Slavic translations of the Bible and the first complete printed edition of the Bible in Church Slavonic, published in Ostroh, in the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth (modern territory of Ukraine), by the printer Ivan Fyodorov in 1581 with the assistance of the Ruthenian Prince Konstantin Ostrogski.

The Ostrog Bible was translated not from the (Hebrew) Masoretic text, but from the (Greek) Septuagint. This translation comprised seventy-six books of the Old and New Testaments and a manuscript of the Codex Alexandrinus. Some parts were based on Francysk Skaryna's translations.
